Posts.Title: Liver Mets Story mimi1030 ejohn

Posts.Content: ejohn wrote: Hi! My mom had a routine CT scan done today and she has been so sick since then. We think she had a bad reaction from the stuff you drink or the dye they give you for the CT scan. She has had diarra and has been throwing up so bad and her stomach is hurting her really bad. She said the pain actually feels like it's in her liver area. She's worried her liver is eat up with cancer and that's what is causing all of this, but she was fine this morning. Has anyone ever had a reaction like this from CT scans? My mom has had them done before and never had one to effect her like this. I've never seen her this sick. She was fine before she had the CT scan this morning that's why I believe all of this has to be coming from that CT scan.  I'm really worrying about her, she's home right now, but I might have to take her to the ER.  Has anyone had this happen before?    Michelle Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Need Help ejohn RobinWendy

Posts.Content: Oct 16, 2007 02:55PM ejohn wrote: Hi!  I've been in the doctor's office all day with my mom. They gave her IV fluids, and some nashua medicine, but she is still feeling bad. Her wbc counts are high. They did a lot of blood work on her to see if she has an infection--won't know anything from that for a couple of days though.  She was supposed to get Chemo tomorrow, but will have to wait until Friday now.  It just seems so strange to me that she got this sick right after the CT scan. Right after she had it done she could hardly talk. They kept her there for about an hour because she was having a hard time talking to monitor her, they did give her benadryl to take and thought she would be fine so they sent her home. After she got home that's when she got so sick to her stomach.  My mom says she will be scared now to ever do another CT scan. She is still so weak.  We also got the report today from the CT scan. My mom has had two spots on her liver for about 11 months now and now one of the spots has decreased in size and the other one is stable, but a new spot has showed up also now--making it 3 spots on the liver. The doctor told us the report was actually pretty good. But we asked to see the CT report and that's when I found out about this new spot that has showed up. So I asked him about it and he told me that he isn't sure if that new spot is cancer. He said it doesn't make sense to him that the other two would have decreased in size and that a new one has showed up. So I hope he's right. Does this sound right?  Can new spots grow and show up in the liver while other ones decrease?
Posts.Title: Need Help ejohn RobinWendy

Posts.Content: ejohn wrote: Hi!  It's been a long time since I've posted on here but I do still try and keep up with everything and everyone.  My mom isn't doing very well.  she is on Gemzar now and has gotten 4 treatments of it, but this last treatment she got over a week ago has really made her feel bad.  I took her to the ER yesterday because she was feeling so bad.  They said all her blood work looked good except that her red blood cells were pretty low almost low enough for a blood transfusion the doctor said, but he only told her to take iron pills instead. Is anyone else taking iron pills while on Chemo?  The doctor in the ER was the one that told us to buy the iron pills.  My mom stays so cold all the time, even if she goes outside and it's 100 degrees out she is still real cold and wants a sweater on.  I'm really worrying about her this time.  For the last week she hasn't had one day that she has felt good.  I don't know what to do or to think about all of this.  I guess the only thing I can do is pray and ask for prayer for her right now.  You all are in my thoughts and prayers as well.    Michelle Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Update on my mom ejohn LuAnnH

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2008 05:56PM ejohn wrote: Hi!  Another update on my mom. We saw the onc on Tuesday and her red blood cells were low so they gave her a shot to boost them up.  She is still feeling very cold though, it hasn't helped any with that. The doctor did tell my mom not to take any iron pills.  She had been feeling pretty good up until today, but she got the Chemo on Tuesday, so I'm thinking it's the Chemo that kicking in now and making her feel so bad. I asked the doctor when would he do more scans on my mom and he said not until some time in Sept. I hate waiting that long.
Posts.Title: Update on my mom ejohn LuAnnH

Posts.Content: ejohn wrote: Well, I took my mom to see her Onc today.  They checked her blood and her red blood cells are real low so tomorrow morning I have to take her into the hospital for a blood transfusion.  She will be getting two units of blood.  I'm hoping this will make her feel better since she's been feeling so bad lately.  She is always so cold, has to wear gloves and a sweater all the time.  Maybe this will help her. She won't be getting any more Chemo until after Sept 5, which kind of worries me going that long without getting anything.  But they are going to do more CT scans on Sept 5th and then go from there on what to do next for her.  Her platelets right now are real low also. Maybe it will do her some good having a break from the Chemo.  Well,  just wanted to update you all on what's going on.  Take Care everyone, you all are in my thoughts and prayers.    Michelle Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: another update on my mom ejohn LuAnnH

Posts.Content: ejohn wrote: It's been a while since I've been on here, but I still come on here everyday and try to keep up with everyone's post. My mom has cancer in her bones and two spots on her liver. She is still on Taxotere she has been on this Chemo for 7 months now. She is going next Monday for more scans to see how the cancer is doing.  She has also had nerve damaged caused by radiation to her right leg that still hasn't gotten any better. If anything it's gotten worse then it was just a month ago.  She can hardly walk anymore.  She also has some tumors in that leg so not sure if all the pain and swelling is from the nerve damage and lymphedema or from the cancer itself.  Nothing she has taking for the pain has helped her.  I hate seeing her like this, my mom used to be so outgoing and full of life. She still is or tries anyway. She's not ready to give up and wants to keep on fighting. Well, this is just an update on my mom and how she's doing. Please keep her in your prayers her name is Ella. Thank you!  Michelle  Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Avastin/Taxol and sore throat AlaskaDeb Roja1955

Posts.Content: ejohn wrote: My mom just had a CT scan of her abdomen and pelvis and a Chest CT scan. Her two liver spots have decreased slightly and no new spots have showed up. Her lungs still look okay with no tumors showing up there. But what has me so worried is how bad my mom feels all the time. Today she is going for a bone scan. Her right leg swells all the time and it hurts her really bad most of the time. She can't take any pain medication because they all make her so sick. She can't do a lot of walking anymore either. It getting harder for her to get up and down also. My mom had radiation to her leg but it didn't help her any. It actually I think made things worst. Now she has Lymphedema in her right leg which the doctor said came from the radiation treatments. The pain is still really bad in that leg. She goes for her 9th treatment of Taxotere Wednesday and that worries me because with every treatment now it seems to bring her down even more. She is also taking Zometa. She stays so tired all the time and it takes her longer and longer with each Chemo treatment to bounce back. My mom is ER+ PR- and Her2 positive. I don't know what to think of all of this. Even though the CT scans of her abdomen and Chest look okay I don't know if it's really good news or not since she feels so bad all the time. Maybe this bone scan will tell us more. My mom was so full of life last year. She's really gone back in the last year since she was diagnosed with bone and liver mets. Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: ejohn wrote: My mom is going in tomorrow to have a MRI done on her brain and spine. She has been off balanced lately and has been having trouble getting up and down. I'm really scared. But she also takes Gabapentin for pain that's a seizure drug, but she takes that to help out with her bone mets pain. She increased that pill last week so I wonder if that could be the reason she's off balanced? Most likely we won't know the test results of the MRI until her next Doctor's appointment which will be next Wednesday. The waiting is so tough, I wish we could find out the results tomorrow or by Friday, but her doctor isn't in on Friday so I doubt we will. I'm just really scared right now. Her bone and liver scans looked pretty good last month I was feeling so good about that and now all of this is happening. I know I shouldn't be thinking and worrying about the worst, but it's hard not to sometimes. Michelle Log in to post a reply
